doc.previous: Furthermore for every x in the interval a b
doc.after: This realization made by both Newton and Leibniz who based their results on earlier work by Isaac Barrow was key to the proliferation of analytic results after their work became known The fundamental theorem provides an algebraic method of computing many definite integrals without performing limit processes by finding formulas for antiderivatives It is also a prototype solution of a differential equation Differential equations relate an unknown function to its derivatives and are ubiquitous in the sciences
